form.title: CLIENT INTAKE

hero.description: Help us understand your business and creative vision. No wrong answers, the more honest you are, the stronger your brand will be.

form.draftBanner: You have a saved draft, your previous answers have been restored.

cta.note: Your answers are auto-saved in your browser so you can return and edit anytime. We'll review your submission and reach out within 2 business days.

q1.label: Describe your business in 2-3 sentences, as if explaining it to a stranger at dinner.
q1.hint: Avoid jargon. Focus on what you do, who you serve, and why it matters.
q1.placeholder: We help independent therapists build a practice that feels like them...

q2.label: What problem do you solve, and what does life look like for your customer after working with you?
q2.hint: Think transformation: the before and after.
q2.placeholder: Before: they struggle with... After: they feel...

q3.label: Paint a vivid picture of your ideal customer.
q3.hint: What do they care about, what do they want to be seen as, and what made them look for you specifically.
q3.placeholder: She runs a small creative business, values authenticity over trends, and wants her brand to feel as considered as her work...

q4.label: List 2-4 competitors or similar brands. What do they do well, and what does your audience find missing from them?
q4.hint: These don't need to be direct competitors. Any brand your audience might also consider.
q4.placeholder: Brand A is strong at X, but feels too cold. Our audience finds them lacking in...

q5.label: If your brand were a person, how would they walk into a room?
q5.hint: Presence, tone of voice, how they dress, how they make people feel. All personality, no product.
q5.placeholder: Confident but never arrogant. They speak slowly and deliberately...

q6.label: Complete this sentence: "We are the only _____ that _____.
q6.hint: Your positioning in one line. Rough is fine, just try.
q6.placeholder: We are the only accounting firm that speaks to creative freelancers without making them feel small.

q7.label: Who is the main action taker / decision maker for this project?

q8.label: Share 3-5 brands or visual references you admire, inside or outside your industry.
q8.hint: Logos, websites, packaging, editorial layouts, even spaces. Links or names both work.
q8.placeholder: Apple (clean, premium), Aesop (earthy, typographic), Dieter Rams (functional beauty)...

q9.label: Which color directions feel right for your brand? Select all that apply.

q10.label: Are there any colors that are completely off-limits?
q10.hint: Due to personal preference, industry association, or competitor use.
q10.placeholder: Please avoid purple, our main competitor uses it...

q11.label: Which aesthetic direction best describes how your brand should look and feel? Select up to two.
q11.hint: Think about texture, attitude, and energy. Focus on the overall feel, not just keywords.

q11Description.placeholder: Or describe your own aesthetic direction...

q12.label: Do you have existing brand assets that must carry into the new identity?
q12.hint: If starting fresh, write "none." If keeping elements, explain what and why.
q12.placeholder: We want to keep our current logo mark but redesign everything else...

q13.label: Which deliverables do you need from this project?
q13.hint: Select all that apply. We'll confirm the scope on our kickoff call.

q14.label: What is your budget approach for this project?

options.best: I want the best possible result no matter the cost

q15.label: Got any logos, photos, or moodboards that inspire your brand's direction? Drop them here. The more I see what moves you, the better I can design for you.
q15.hint: Up to 8 images. PNG, JPG, WEBP, or GIF.
q15.uploadLimit: Up to 8 images · PNG, JPG, WEBP, GIF

q16.label: Is there anything about your past branding experience, strong preferences, or fears we should know before we start?
q16.hint: The more openly you share, the better we can tailor this to you.
q16.placeholder: The last agency gave us something too generic. We really want this to feel like us...

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: At Neatmark, we take your privacy seriously. This page explains what information we collect when you use our client intake form, how we use it, and how we protect it. We have written this in plain language on purpose. You deserve to know exactly what happens with your data, without having to decode legal jargon.
privacy.s1_p1: When you fill out and submit the Neatmark client intake form, we collect the following:
privacy.s1_li5: Your answers to the brand questionnaire, including any written descriptions, preferences, and uploaded inspiration images
privacy.s1_p2: We do not collect any payment information, identification documents, or sensitive personal data through this form.
privacy.s2_p1: The information you share with us is used for one purpose only: to understand your brand needs so we can do our best work for you. Specifically, your submission helps us prepare for your project kickoff, tailor our design approach to your vision, and keep a record of your brief throughout the collaboration.
privacy.s2_p2: We do not use your information for marketing campaigns, analytics profiling, or any automated decision-making. We do not send you unsolicited emails based on your submission beyond what is directly related to your project with us.
privacy.s3_title: We do not sell or share your data
privacy.s3_p1: Your information is never sold to third parties. We do not work with advertising networks, data brokers, or third-party marketing services of any kind. Your submission is not used to build advertising profiles, and it is not shared with anyone outside of the Neatmark team.
privacy.s3_p2: The only time we would share information is if we were legally required to do so by a court order or applicable law, which we would only comply with to the extent necessary.
privacy.s4_p1: Your submission is stored securely in a private database. Only authorized Neatmark administrators can access the dashboard where submissions are stored. No client can see another client's submission. Access is protected by authentication and is limited to team members who need it to manage your project.
privacy.s4_p2: Your inspiration images and any uploaded files are stored in a private, access-controlled storage system. Direct links to your files are not publicly guessable or indexable.
privacy.s5_p1: We take reasonable technical and organizational steps to keep your information safe. Our database and file storage are hosted on platforms that use industry-standard encryption at rest and in transit. Access credentials are kept private and are not shared outside the Neatmark team.
privacy.s5_p2: While no system on the internet can be guaranteed 100% secure, we do our best to make sure your data is handled responsibly.
privacy.s6_p1: The form uses your browser's local storage to automatically save your answers as you type, so you don't lose your work if you close the tab. This data lives entirely in your own browser and is never sent to our servers until you press Submit. You can clear your saved draft at any time using the Clear Draft button in the form.
privacy.s7_title: How long we keep your data
privacy.s7_p1: We keep your submission for as long as it is relevant to your project and our working relationship. If you would like your information removed from our records at any point, just send us an email and we will take care of it promptly.
privacy.s8_p1: You have the right to ask us what data we hold about you, request a correction if anything is inaccurate, and ask us to delete your data. To exercise any of these rights, reach out to us directly at the contact details on our website. We will respond as quickly as we can.
privacy.s9_p1: If we make any meaningful changes to how we handle your data, we will update this page and revise the date at the top. We will not retroactively apply practices that are materially worse than what was in place when you submitted your form.
privacy.s10_p1: If you have any questions about this policy or about how your data is handled, please reach out through our website at neatmark.studio. We are happy to talk through anything that is unclear.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.intro: This page explains how the Neatmark client intake form uses cookies and browser storage. We keep this minimal. We are not an advertising platform, we do not track you across the web, and we do not sell or share browsing data with anyone.
cookies.s1_p1: Cookies are small pieces of data stored in your browser by a website you visit. Some are essential for a site to function, and some are used to remember your preferences. Our form uses browser local storage rather than traditional cookies for most of its functionality, but the rules are the same and you deserve to know about both.
cookies.s2_p1: The table below covers everything the Neatmark form stores in your browser.
cookies.s2_r1_purpose: Remembers your preferred color theme (light, dark, or auto) so it is applied on every visit without asking again.
cookies.s2_r2_purpose: Auto-saves your form answers as you type so you do not lose progress if you close the tab or navigate away. Cleared when you submit or click Clear Draft.
cookies.s2_r3_purpose: Saves your language selection so the form loads in the right language on your next visit.
cookies.s2_p2: None of these items are used for tracking, analytics, or advertising. They exist purely to make the form more comfortable to use.
cookies.s3_p1: Our form uses a small number of external resources to function properly:
cookies.s3_li1: Google Fonts loads the typefaces used in the form design. When your browser requests a font, Google may log your IP address as part of the standard web request. We do not control this.
cookies.s3_li2: Netlify Identity handles administrator authentication for the dashboard. It sets its own session cookies to keep admins logged in. This only applies to Neatmark staff, not to clients filling out the form.
cookies.s3_p2: We do not use Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, or any other advertising or behavioral tracking tool. No third-party marketing service receives any data about you or your visit.
cookies.s4_title: How to clear or disable storage
cookies.s4_p1: You are in full control of what gets stored in your browser. You can clear any of the items listed above at any time by going to your browser's settings and clearing site data for this domain. Most browsers also let you block local storage entirely, though doing so may affect how the form saves your draft progress.
cookies.s4_p2: The form itself also includes a Clear Draft button that removes the saved draft from your browser without affecting any other stored preferences.
cookies.s5_title: We do not use advertising cookies
cookies.s5_p1: We want to be clear about this. No advertising network tracks visits to this form. No retargeting pixel fires when you load this page. We do not use your visit to serve you ads elsewhere on the internet. The data you share here stays here, used only to work on your project with you.
cookies.s6_p1: If we ever add new storage items or third-party services, we will update this page and the date at the top. We will not introduce tracking or advertising technologies without being transparent about it here first.
cookies.s7_p1: If you have any questions about cookies or how your browser data is handled, you can reach us through our website at neatmark.studio.
